title: Explosion near Moscow train station kills police officer
description: The unidentified suspect also died and two other officers were injured, Russian officials say.
content:
An explosion outside a train station in Moscow has killed one traffic police officer and injured two others, the Russian Interior Ministry has said.
Police had been patrolling their vehicle at Savyolovsky Station Square, north of the city centre, whe... [343 chars]

title: GPs get £3,000 bonus to maximise weight loss drug prescriptions
description: Bid to improve access to Mounjaro in England, but experts warn eligibility still tightly restricted.
content:
GPs in England are to be paid £3,000 a year bonuses to prescribe patients weight loss drugs.
The government is adding the incentive payments to the GP contract starting in April.
GPs will also get extra money – worth about £1,000 a year - for referri... [3671 chars]

title: 'Miracle' baby born to first UK womb transplant from deceased donor
description: Grace Bell, who was born without a viable womb, says her little boy is "simply a miracle".
content:
A baby boy has become the first child in the UK to be born using a womb transplanted from a deceased donor.
Grace Bell, who is in her 30s and was born without a viable womb, says her little boy Hugo, who is now 10 weeks old, is "simply a miracle".

title: Benjamin Sesko and Senne Lammens give Man Utd real hope of Champions League return
description: Striker Benjamin Sesko and goalkeeper Senne Lammens are the key figures as Manchester United gain a hugely valuable Premier League win at Everton.
content:
Michael Carrick had a neat way of describing Benjamin Sesko's assimilation into life at Manchester United.
"He is growing as a player," said United's head coach. "Sometimes it's big steps, sometimes it's little steps. He has taken some huge ones rece... [5544 chars]

title: 'Simply a miracle': Baby boy born from dead donor womb transplant in UK first
description: Hugo Powell was delivered by caesarean section in London after his mother underwent transplant surgery in 2024. She said she was the "happiest I've ever been in my life".
content:
A baby boy has become the first child in Britain to be born to a mother with a womb transplanted from a deceased donor.
Hugo Powell was delivered by caesarean section in December, weighing 6lb 13oz (3.1kg), at the Queen Charlotte's and Chelsea Hospit... [3774 chars]
